vision.notes: Large eyes suggest vision is important, although its specific role in deep-sea environments is unknown. Correlated with large eyes.

lateral_line.notes: Well-developed lateral line system, typical of deep-sea fish.

chemoreception.notes: Numerous chemoreceptors located on the head and lips, and chemosensory barbels underneath the chin.

mechanoreception.notes: Benthic species possess swim bladders with muscles that are thought to produce sound via strumming. Possibly used in courtship and mate location.

bioluminescence.notes: Light-producing organs (photophores) are present in some species. Located in the mid-ventral region.
